intro: Sutera griquensis, commonly known as the Grootfontein nightshade, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and tobacco. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching up to 3 meters in height. Its leaves are ovate and slightly hairy, while its flowers are white or pale purple, often appearing in clusters. Sutera griquensis is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils.
